stable_strings: !This program cannot be run in DOS mode.

anti-analysis/anti-debugging/debugger-de: check for time delay via QueryPerformanceCounter (4 matches)
anti-analysis/anti-vm/vm-detection: check for unmoving mouse cursor (2 matches)
communication: query remote server for available data
data-manipulation/prng/mersenne: generate random numbers using a Mersenne Twister (4 matches)
host-interaction/process: get thread local storage value (2 matches)
host-interaction/registry: query or enumerate registry key (2 matches)
query or enumerate registry value (5 matches)
host-interaction/thread/tls: set thread local storage value (2 matches)
linking/runtime-linking: link function at runtime on Windows (19 matches)
load-code/pe: resolve function by parsing PE exports (15 matches)

DEFENSE EVASION: File and Directory Permissions Modification:: T1222
Virtualization/Sandbox Evasion::User Activity Based Checks T1497.002
DISCOVERY: System Location Discovery::System Language Discovery T1614.001
PERSISTENCE: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution::Shortcut Modification T1547.009

attributes.magic: PE32 executable (GUI) Intel 80386, for MS Windows

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Identifies compiled AutoIT script (as EXE). This rule by itself does NOT necessarily mean the detected file is malicious.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: @bartblaze

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: New RUN Key Pointing to Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious new RUN key element pointing to an executable in a suspicious folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Sander Wiebing, Swachchhanda Shrawan Poudel (Nextron Systems)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: A General detection for files being created in the Windows startup directory. This could be an indicator of persistence.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Unsigned DLL Loaded by Windows Utility
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects windows utilities loading an unsigned or untrusted DLL.
Adversaries often abuse those programs to proxy execution of malicious code.
Detects modification of autostart extensibility point (ASEP) in registry.
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Victor Sergeev, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Gleb Sukhodolskiy, Timur Zinniatullin, oscd.community, Tim Shelton, frack113 (split)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.

yara_rules.author: @bartblaze
yara_rules.description: Identifies compiled AutoIT script (as EXE). This rule by itself does NOT necessarily mean the detected file is malicious.

yara_rules.author: ReversingLabs
yara_rules.description: Yara rule that detects AsyncRAT backdoor.

yara_rules.author: DiegoAnalytics
yara_rules.description: CrossPlatform All Malwares Detector: Detect PE, ELF, Mach-O, scripts, archives; overlay, obfuscation, encryption, spoofing, hiding, high entropy, network communication

yara_rules.author: DiegoAnalytics
yara_rules.description: Detects attempts to inject code into another process across PE, ELF, Mach-O binaries

yara_rules.author: daniyyell
yara_rules.description: Detects obfuscated PowerShell commands commonly used in malicious scripts.

yara_rules.author: ditekSHen
yara_rules.description: Detects Windows executables referencing non-Windows User-Agents

yara_rules.author: Lucas Acha (http://www.lukeacha.com)
yara_rules.description: Generic Detection for multiple RAT families, PUPs, Packers and suspicious executables

yara_rules.author: SECUINFRA Falcon Team
yara_rules.description: Detecs .NET Binary that lists installed AVs

yara_rules.author: XiAnzheng
yara_rules.description: May Contain(Obfuscated or no) Powershell or CMD Command that can be abused by threat actor(can create FP)

yara_rules.author: Matthew @ Embee_Research
yara_rules.description: Detects bytestring present in unobfuscated xworm

behaviour.rule: Unauthorized injection to a system process
Enabling autorun by creating a file
Enabling autorun with the standard Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Run registry branch
Setting a global event handler for the keyboard
Creating a file in the %temp% directory
Creating a file in the %AppData% directory
Using the Windows Management Instrumentation requests

signatures.signature: Adds Run key to start application
System Location Discovery: System Language Discovery

hybridanalysis.type: PE32 executable (GUI) Intel 80386, for MS Windows, 5 sections
